summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Tova Noel by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding her appearance on August 16, 2019, to testify and produce documents and electronic devices related to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction statutes.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before the grand jury and produce materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and any cellphone used since July 6, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands all materials relating to him, indicating he is central to the grand jury's investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman

connections.description: The subpoena commands Tova Noel to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating she is a person of interest in the investigation concerning him.
As the U.S. Attorney, Berman issued the subpoena commanding Noel's appearance and production of documents before the grand jury.

events.title: Grand jury appearance of Tova Noel
events.description: Tova Noel is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce evidence.

One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active grand jury investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (obstruction).
It commands Tova Noel to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including electronic communications and devices.
The subpoena specifically demands any cellphone in Noel's possession used since July 6, 2019, indicating that period is of investigative interest.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman and dated August 11, 2019, showing federal prosecutors were actively pursuing the case after Epstein's arrest.
